abstracts.cdata!:
The International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) has helped several
            Latin American and Caribbean countries access financial
            markets to provide funds to cope with future disasters.
            Innovative financial initiatives supported by the IBRD
            enabled Costa Rica to quickly access funds after an
            earthquake in January 2009. Such initiatives will also allow
            Haiti to quickly draw upon desperately-needed money in the
            wake of the catastrophic earthquake there.
